page.title: 15Malmesbury Abbey
page.content: {The Abbey}has been rebuilt 4 times since 767.The present building has been there from the 12th century.The Abbey's spire collapsed in 1480.Only one fifth of the original building is left.Every year approximately 2,000 people from many different countries come to see our Abbey.Inside there is a{new organ}which cost Â£72,000 to be made.It has got about 3,000 pipes in it.The Abbey is used for{weddings, {funerals,christenings,concerts}and it also acts as a{parish church.}The Abbey can hold 300 people comfortably.But it has been known to hold 1,000 people,who were all very squashed.One of the stained glass windows has a picture of{Oliver {(Elmer) the flying monk}who jumped off the Abbey.A lot of the Abbey has been replaced.
